abstract: Law enforcement officials in Waco, Tex, say majority of shots fired in violent outburst between rival biker gangs came from suspects' guns, rather than from responding police officers, who reportedly disabled automatic setting on their firearms.
lead_paragraph: Chief Brent Stroman said that only three of the nearly two dozen officers outside the Twin Peaks restaurant on May 17 fired their weapons following a dispute between rival biker gangs.

headline.main: Texas: Most Shots at Melee Were Fired by Bikers, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Texas: Most Shots at Melee Were Fired by Bikers, Police Say

snippet: Chief Brent Stroman said that only three of the nearly two dozen officers outside the Twin Peaks restaurant on May 17 fired their weapons following a dispute between rival biker gangs.
